Note.Content: NJPS | RSV NRSV REB ESV "present himself" NIV "come" NJB "leave (the womb)" GNT "come out"
RSV NRSV "delay" NJPS "tarry" | NIV "stand up for" ESV "take your stand" NJB "be obstinate" REB "persist"
MT העמדת | RSV ESV "made to shake" NIV "were wrenched" NJPS "make unsteady" NRSV "made unsteady" NJB "making give way" REB "gave way"

LEXSense.DefinitionShort: = process by which humans, deities, animals, or inanimate objects take position in a certain location in an upright position
= causative process by which humans or deities cause (other) humans or animals to take position in a certain location in an upright position
literally: to stand; hence: = state in which humans are alive and well
literally: to stand over (one's) self; hence: = action by which humans do what they can do to preserve their life
literally: to stand (against); hence: = action by which humans engage in a conflict with someone else
literally: to stand up; hence: = state in which a new ruler or kingdom is in power
literally: to cause to stand up; hence: = causative process by which a deity causes a new ruler or kingdom to come to power
literally: to stand by; hence: = action by which humans do not engage in an event directly
literally: to stand still; hence: = process by which a certain event stops happening spontaneously
literally: to stand still; hence: = action by which a person stops performing a certain event
literally: to stand; hence: = process by which an event continues for an extended period of time
literally: to cause to stand; hence: = causative process by which humans or deities cause an event to continue for an extended period of time
literally: to stand in (a covenant); hence: = action by which humans participate in an event
literally: to cause to stand in (a covenant); hence: = causative action by which humans cause other humans to participate in an event
literally: to stand; hence: = state in which humans, deities or objects are in existence
literally: to stand; hence: = process by which humans come together in a large group
literally: to cause to stand; hence: = causative process by which humans bring together a large group of people
literally: to arise; hence: = process by which an event starts happening
literally: to cause to arise; hence: = causative action by which humans cause an event to start happening
literally: to cause to stand; hence: = causative action by which humans restore an object to make it function again in the way it has functioned before
literally: to stand; hence: = action by which humans actively carry out the role that has been assigned to them
literally: to cause to stand; hence: = causative action by which humans or deities assign a certain role or responsibility to (other) humans
literally: to stand before (someone); hence: = state in which humans are in someone else's service
literally: to stand; = state or process by which an inanimate object is in what is perceived to be an upright position in a certain location without moving away
literally: to cause to stand; hence: = causative action by which humans place inanimate objects in what is perceived to be an upright position, without moving away
= state in which humans, deities or inanimate objects remain in a certain place for an extended period of time
literally: to stay; = state in which people dwell permanently in a certain area
literally: to cause to stay; hence: = causative action by which deities cause humans to dwell permanently in a certain area
literally: to stand; hence: = state in which an object is firmly located in a certain place
literally: to make stand firm; hence: = action by which humans keep the expression on their face unchanged for some time
literally: to stand firm; hence: = state in which humans or animals have the physical strength to withstand forces from outside, such as a natural force or an enemy
literally: to cause to stand firm; hence: = causative action by which deities cause humans to have the physical strength to withstand forces from outside, such as an enemy
literally: to stand (firm); hence: = state in which humans have the inner strength to persist in a certain activity in spite of opposition
literally: to cause to stand (firm); hence: = causative action by which deities cause humans to have the inner strength to persist in a certain activity in spite of opposition
read {L:מעד<SDBH:מעד>}
